message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of reconstructing time sequences of sparse signals from limited noisy linear measurements, which is a common problem in signal processing and image analysis. The proposed solution involves using compressed sensing on the least squares residual computed using the previous estimate of the support, which is a novel approach. This makes it likely that the paper belongs to the Information Theory (cs.IT), Signal Processing (cs.SP), and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper includes a dynamic MRI example, which suggests that it may also belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Systems and Control (cs.SI) sub-categories.
